there is nothing i can say about this animal to do it justice. nothing.

This is the Mary River Turtle, Elusor macrurus. Itâs critically endangered due to dams and that would be a damnÂ shame because this is the most punk rock animal Iâve ever seen. They donât all have the moss hairdos, but theyâre all this punk rock on the inside.Â 

Anyways, Irwinâs Turtle! I bet you can guess whoÂ Elseya irwini is named after!

Thatâs right, Steve Irwin! Steve and his folks were on this camping trip and his dad was fishing and he caught this thing and they sent snaps of it to John Cann- who actually, he kinda comes up in the last post I made, as heâs the fella Cannâs side-necked turtle is named after- and John Cann was all âWOAH, thatâs a new turtle!â and so we have this super rare, super amazing turtle named after Steve Irwin. And this turtle can do some really amazing things.Â 

Amazing Thing the First: This turtle has a built-in hat.Â 

Itâs got this little golden crown built in so that nobody will ever confuse it for a peasant amongst turtles.

Amazing Thing the Second: It only lives in part of one river and as a result is facing extinctio- wait, no, thatâs not amazing at all. Why does Australia keep damming up all its turtle rivers? Damn your dam, youâre throwing away biodiversity and a turtle with a built-in crown! They have it hard enough, what with the crocodiles and the dang goannas eating their eggs!

Amazing Thing the Third:Â him breathe out own ass.. w

Yes, itâs true; Irwinâs turtle is a bimodalÂ breather. That means that instead of just breathing out their nostrils like us plebs, this majestic beast can take water into its cloaca and actually breatheÂ that way. Thereâs a gill-like structure in a chamber just past the cloaca and while they usually breathe normally, they can respire quite well through their cloaca. Thereâs other turts that can do it, too- both new world and old world species- but none of themÂ have a crown.
